words.definition: If something is above, it is at a higher level than something else.
words.example: He straightened the sign that was above the crowd.

words.definition: If something is ahead of something else, it is in front of it.
words.example: The blue car drove on ahead of us.

words.definition: An amount is how much there is of something.
words.example: Can I use my card to pay for the entire amount?

words.definition: A belief is a strong feeling that something is correct or true.
words.example: A preacher or priest should have a strong belief in God.

words.definition: The center of something is the middle of it.
words.example: The center of a dart board is the most important spot.

words.definition: If something is common, it happens often or there is much of it.
words.example: It is common for snow to fall in the winter.

words.definition: To cost is to require expenditure or payment.
words.example: These designer shoes cost more than the regular ones.

words.definition: To demonstrate something is to show how it is done.
words.example: She demonstrated her plan to her co-workers.

words.definition: Different describes someone or something that is not the same as others.
words.example: Each of my sisters has a different hair style from one another.

words.definition: Evidence is a fact or thing that you use to prove something.
words.example: He used the pictures as evidence that UFOs are real.

words.definition: Honesty means the quality of being truthful or honest.
words.example: A courtroom should be a place of honesty.

words.definition: An idiom is a phrase with a meaning different from its words.
words.example: The idiom “when pigs fly” means that something will never happen.

words.definition: If something is independent, it is not controlled by something else.
words.example: She chose to live an independent life in the country.

words.definition: Inside means the inner part, space or side of something.
words.example: The inside of the box was empty.

words.definition: A master is a person who is very good at something.
words.example: My brother is a master of taekwondo.

words.definition: A memory is something you remember.
words.example: The memory of my first time in the city will always be the best.

words.definition: If something is proper, it is right.
words.example: It is not proper to throw your garbage on the road.

words.definition: To scan something is to look at it very carefully.
words.example: You must scan each person closely.

words.definition: A section is a part of something larger.
words.example: The green section of the graph is the most important part.

words.definition: The surface of something is the top part or outside of it.
words.example: The surface of the moon is very rough.
